title: The Reachability Problem for Neural-Network Control Systems
abstract:
A control system consists of a plant component and a controller which
periodically computes a control input for the plant. We consider systems where
the controller is implemented by a feedforward neural network with ReLU
activations. The reachability problem asks, given a set of initial states,
whether a set of target states can be reached. We show that this problem is
undecidable even for trivial plants and fixed-depth neural networks with three
inputs and outputs. We also show that the problem becomes semi-decidable when
the plant as well as the input and target sets are given by automata over
infinite words.
